sources.full: One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits Dungeon Master Guide

monster.name: Sea King Wyrmling
languages: telepathy 120 ft. (with others that can hear the "voice of all things")

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sea king can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The sea king deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the sea king can't constrict another target.

action.name: Tidal Cannon {@recharge 5}
entries: The sea king exhales a 15-foot cone crushing wave of frigid seawater. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage and 11 ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage, and is pushed 15 feet away from the sea king and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The whale can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The whale can hold its breath for 30 minutes

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The whale has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The whale deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Vast Stomach
entries: There exists a large open sea full of stomach acid in the whale's stomach which can hold a number of small islands, homes, or ships it swallows equal to its Constitution modiifer. If the capacity is reached, the whale cannot swallow anymore objects or creatures. A creature that spends more than a day in its stomach acid-infused waters falls to 0 hit points and dies as a result of being digested by the whale, unless the creature remains above water.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Adult Island Whale. If an island whale is fully grown, it is grows to epic proportions. Use the "Island Eater" statblock listed later in this section for the whale, but use the island whale's Echolocation and Keen hearing instead of the island eater's Reflective Scales trait, use the island whale's Hold Breath trait instead of the island eater's Water Breathing trait, and use the island eater's Vast Stomach trait and Swallow ability instead of the island eater's Annihilating Stomach trait and Swallow ability. Also, the island whale cannot use its Swallow ability as a part of its legendary actions or multiattack action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whale makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled}, escape {@dc 17}. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the island eater can't bite another target

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Swallow {@recharge}
entries: If the whale has half of its movement remaining, it moves into a space that is occupied by one or more creatures. Any creature or vehicle in the area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or it becomes swallowed by the whale. On a success, a target is pushed 10 feet out of the whale's space. If there is no empty space to be pushed into, the target is knocked {@condition prone} is knocked {@condition prone} in the whale's space if its a creature. If there is a fixed object with 50 hit points or less in the space, it is destroyed. Otherwise, the whale is pushed out of the space into a nearby empty space it can fit into.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sea beast can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the sea beast moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tidal Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The sea beast exhales a 30-foot cone of cold seawater. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

monster.name: Ancient Sea King
languages: telepathy 120 ft. (with others that can hear the "voice of all things")

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sea king can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistances (3/Day)
entries: If the sea king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rage of The Sea (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the sea king would be reduced to 0 Hit Points, its current hit point total instead resets to 350 Hit Points, and it recharges its Seawater Cannon. Additionally, the sea king can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 62,000 XP (124,000 XP total) for defeating the sea king after its Rage of The Sea activates.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The sea king deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sea king can make one Bite attack and one Constrict or Tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d12 + 9}) piercing damage plus ({@dice 1d12}) cold damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 24}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the sea king can't constrict another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Seawater Cannon {@recharge 5}
entries: The sea king exhales a 90-foot cone wave of frigid seawater. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 44 ({@damage 8d10}) bludgeoning damage and 44 ({@damage 8d10}) cold damage, and is pushed 15 feet away from the sea king and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: The sea king makes one Tail attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The sea king moves up to its speed. If the sea king is swimming, this movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Tidal Wave (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The sea king unleashes a wave of water that crashes down in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide and 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage and 11 ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If the sea king's Rage of the Sea trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Bite
entries: The sea king makes one Bite attack.

mythic.name: Roar of Storms (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The sea king unleashes a magical roar. Each creature in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the sea king must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) thunder damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

monster.name: Naitamie-Norida Elephant
languages: telepathy 120 ft. (with others that can hear the "voice of all things")

trait.name: Ancient Wrath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the Naitamie-Norida Elephant would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, and it recharges its Trunk Slam, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance.. Additionally, the elephant can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the elephant after its Ancient Wrath activates.

trait.name: Legendary Resistances (4/Day)
entries: If the Naitamie-Norida Elephant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Long Legs
entries: The Naitamie-Norida Elephant can walk through bodies of water normally using its walking speed, as its legs will extend to the sea floor.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the Naitamie-Norida Elephant moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the elephant can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elephant makes one Trunk or Gore attack and one Stomp attack.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d8 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Trunk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be pushed 30 feet away from the elephant and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Trunk Slam {@recharge 5}
entries: The elephant winds up and slams its trunk downward with all its strength in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide, striking everything beneath it. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw, taking 78 ({@damage 12d12}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or taking half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

action.name: Water Pump (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The elephant pumps water from its trunk into an area within 120 feet of it. It covers a square mile of area with rushing seawater that fills any cracks or recesses. A creature that starts its turn in the moving water must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be pushed up to 30 feet in the direction the water is moving. The moving water settles after 1 minute.

legendary.name: Gore
entries: The elephant makes one Gore attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The elephant moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Thrash (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The elephant thrashes violently, shaking every creature on it or nearby. Any creature currently on the elephant or standing within 120 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
If the Naitamie-Norida Elephant's Ancient Wrath trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Trunk
entries: The elephant makes one Trunk attack.

mythic.name: Deafening Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The elephant unleashes a deafening roar. Each creature in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the sea king must succeed on a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d12}) thunder damage and be {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The centipede can breathe air and water.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus ({@dice 7d6}) poison damage. The target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking the poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the centipede can't constrict another target.

trait.name: Annihilating Stomach
entries: Any creature reduced to 0 hit points while within the island eater's stomach is fully digested and dies and can't be revived by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the island eater fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The island eater has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Scales
entries: Any time the island eater is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the island eater is unaffected. On a 6, the island eater is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the island eater, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The island eater deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The island eater can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The island eater can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its fins, one with its slam, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d12 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled}, escape {@dc 20}. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the island eater can't bite another target.

action.name: Fin
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pushed 30 feet away from the island eater.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the island eater's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the island eater is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the island eater's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The island eater makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the island eater, and it takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the island eater's turns.

If the island eater takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the island eater must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures and objects, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the island eater. If the island eater dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The island eater makes one fin or tail attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The island eater moves up to half its speed without provoking an opportunity attack.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The island eater makes one bite attack or uses its swallow.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the fighting fish jumps at least 15 ft. as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 ft. out of the fighting fish's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the fighting fish's space.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition grappled}, escape {@dc 17} Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the squid can't use the same tentacle on another target. The squid has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Medium or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the squid is thrown up to 30 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the komatori moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a talon attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the komatori can make an attack with its beak against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge

If the target is {@condition prone}, the komashika can make an attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

If the target is {@condition prone}, the komainu can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Weapon Form
entries: Being trained to be used as a bow, a snake weapon can use its action to transformform into a functional bow or quarterstaff that can be used by any creature that has proficiency with using the chosen weapon. It reverts back to its regular snake form when it falls to 0 hit points or spends a bonus action to do so.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}(1) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage. The target must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, taking the poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Forest Camouflage
entries: The snake has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in forests or jungles.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The snake makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the snake. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the snake, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the snake's turns. If the snake takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the snake must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the snake. If the snake dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition grappled}, escape {@dc 19} Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the snake can't constrict another target. A {@condition grappled} creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns.

The rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the octopus runs out of breath. If the creature or object lands before the octopus deflates or lets go, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet.

entries: A 5-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the octopus. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current or wind can disperse the ink. After releasing the ink, the octopus can use the Dash action as a bonus action.

monster.name: Silver Den Den Mushi
languages: telepathy global (only with a willing Golden Den Den Mushi device)

trait.name: Customizable
entries: The Den Den Mushi can be modified and decorated to resemble its owner using special accessories. It can otherwise be altered by its owner in any way they see fit, so long as it doesn't damage or harm the snail in any significant way. When purchasing a Den Den Mushi from a store, it is possible to bundle in such accessories along with the original price of the Den Den Mushi.

trait.name: Communication Tool
entries: The Den Den Mushi serves as a natural communication device that can be used to contact other Den Den Mushi owners or perform a variety of advanced functions that would normally be designated to electronic devices, such as cameras, telephones, cell phones, projectors, etc.

The Silver Den Den Mushi is a rare breed is used for the sole purpose of activating an alarm when it receives a signal from a Golden Den Den Mushi. When it receives such a signal, it will generate a loud alarm sound that can be heard from up to 100 feet away.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}(1) piercing damage.

action.name: Shell Defense
entries: The Den Den Mushi withdraws into its shell, gaining a +4 bonus to AC until it emerges and cannot use its Communication Tool trait or Bite. It can emerge from its shell as a bonus action on its turn.

While attached to a Den Den Mushi this way, when a Black Den Den Mushi is attempting to intercept that Den Den Mushi's telepathic communication line, it must beat the White Den Den Mushi's passive perception instead of the Den Den Mushi it is attached to in order to succeed.

monster.name: Black Den Den Mushi
languages: telepathy global (only with other Den Den Mushi devices it can intercept)

trait.name: Customizable
entries: The Den Den Mushi can be modified and decorated to resemble its owner using special accessories. It can otherwise be altered by its owner in any way they see fit, so long as it doesn't damage or harm the snail in any significant way. trait.name: Communication Tool
entries: The Den Den Mushi serves as a natural communication device that can be used to contact other Den Den Mushi owners or perform a variety of advanced functions that would normally be designated to electronic devices, such as cameras, telephones, cell phones, projectors, etc.

The Black Den Den Mushi is capable of eavesdropping into the telepathic communication line between other Den Den Mushi devices undetected. To do so, the Black Den Den Mushi's user must touch the Black Den Den Mushi and spend an action to intercept a call in between two Den Den Mushi users it knows and the Black Den Den Mushi must make a Dexterity (Stealth) check against the target Den Den Mushis' passive Perception. If this check succeeds, the line is successfully intercepted, and the Black Den Den Mushi can relay and save any portion of the call for its user to hear. The Black Den Den Mushi can intercept a call for up to 10 minutes, until the call ends, or until its user ends the interception as a bonus action. Once this feature is used, the Black Den Den Mushi cannot be used for 1 hour.

languages: telepathy global (only with other willing Den Den Mushi devices)

The Standard Den Den Mushi is used as a real world telephone. It has a dial, receiver, and other parts that allow for it to telepathically communicate with other Standard Den Den Mushi phone devices. To contact another Den Den Mushi user using one's own Den Den Mushi, one must touch the Den Den Mushi and spend an action to dial the target creature's Den Den Mushi number into the dialer implanted into the Den Den Mushi's shell. The Den Den Mushi user receiving a call will have to pick up the receiver using an action after hearing it ring in order to connect a telepathic line between both Den Den Mushi devices. With the ability to perfectly emulate the speech and facial expressions of the creature on the other line, it serves as a representation of the individual a user is calling as they look and speak into it, and vice versa with the user as well. A creature must remain within 5 feet of the Den Den Mushi at all times to be able to communicate through it. To end the communication line, one of the call participants must spend a bonus action to "hang up" the Den Den Mushi.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Six Powers and Haki)
headerEntries: The Navy Legend's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}; {@hit 17} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: At Will: detect magic, dispel magic, toll the dead (17th level)  3/day each: blur, dominate person, fear, jump (self)  1/day each: arcane eye, control weather, death ward (self), dominate monster, earthquake, foresight, phantasmal killer (9th-level), psychic scream

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Navy Legend fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: King's Infusion Armament Haki
entries: The Navy Legend's weapon attacks count as magical for the Purpose of overcoming Resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage, such as resistances granted by Devil Fruits. The Navy Legend also adds an additional ({@dice 9d8}) force damage onto its melee weapon attacks and increases its melee weapon attack range by 5 feet.

trait.name: Observation Haki (3/Day)
entries: Whenever the Navy Legend makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, it can decide to roll an additional {@dice d20}. It can choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. The Navy Legend can change the outcome of a roll when an attack is made against it. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or the Navy Legend's. If more than one creature uses observation haki to influence the outcome of a roll, any disadvantage or advantage from observation haki applied to the roll will be canceled; no additional dice are rolled.

trait.name: Conqueror's Haki (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the Navy Legend can manifest its frightful presence. Each creature of its choice that is within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. A creature that fails becomes {@condition frightened} of it for 1 minute. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is incapactiated until the start of the Navy Legend's next turn. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Hero's Mighty Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the Navy Legend would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 500 hit points, it recharges its Galaxy Impact, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the Navy Legend can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the Navy Legend after its Hero's Mighty Surge activates.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the Navy Legend can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Devil Fruit User. If the Navy Legend has consumed a Devil Fruit, it gains a Legendary Devil Fruit power, granting the Navy Legend any abilities and spells it gives. The Navy Legend will also gain all the weaknesses given to Devil Fruit users, such as water and seastone vulnerability. Its CR also increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Navy Legend makes three unarmed strikes or one Massive Cannonball Toss attack. It can replace each of its unarmed strikes with a Bone Crusher Technique against a creature it has {@condition grappled}, but can't use it against the same target more than once per turn.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 5d12 + 13}) bludgeoning damage plus ({@dice 9d8}) force damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} by the Navy Legend (escape {@dc 23}). The Navy Legend can only grapple one creature at a time this way.

action.name: Massive Cannonball Toss
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 600 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 20d10 + 13}) bludgeoning damage

action.name: Bone Crusher Technique
entries: The Navy Legend makes one of the following attacks against a creature it is grappling:

items.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 5d12 + 13}) bludgeoning damage plus ({@dice 9d8}) force damage, and the target has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of the Navy Legend's next turn.

items.name: Backbreaker
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 5d12 + 13}) bludgeoning damage plus ({@dice 9d8}) force damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of the Navy Legend's next turn.

items.name: Suplex
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 8d12 + 13}) bludgeoning damage plus ({@dice 9d8}) force damage, and the target is knocked {@condition prone} and released from the Navy Legend's Grapple.

action.name: Shave
entries: The Navy Legend magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Galaxy Impact {@recharge 5}
entries: The Navy Legend slams the ground, releasing a shockwave in a 120-foot radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 29} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes ({@dice 14d12}) force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Navy Legend can move up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Attack (2/Round)
entries: The Navy Legend makes a weapon attack.

legendary.name: Shave (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Navy Legend uses it's Shave action.
If the Navy Legend's Hero's Mighty Surge trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Brace for Impact (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Navy Legend manifests its spirit into a suit of armor that protects it; it gains 77 temporary hit points until the start of its next turn.

mythic.name: Crippling Black Fist (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 10d20}) force damage and the targets speed is reduced in half and they cannot regain hit points for 1 day. The target can make a {@dc 29} Constitution saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effects on itself on a success, or taking a ({@dice 10d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Six Powers and Haki)
headerEntries: The Dread Yonko's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 26}; {@hit 18} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: At Will: detect magic, dispel magic, toll the dead (17th level)  3/day each: blur, dominate person, fear, jump (self)  1/day each: arcane eye, control weather, death ward (self), dominate monster, earthquake, foresight, phantasmal killer (9th-level), psychic scream

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Dread Yonko fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: King's Infusion Armament Haki
entries: The Dread Yonko's weapon attacks count as magical for the Purpose of overcoming Resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage, such as resistances granted by Devil Fruits. The Dread Yonko also adds an additional ({@dice 9d8}) force damage onto its melee weapon attacks and increases its melee weapon attack range by 5 feet.

trait.name: Observation Haki (3/Day)
entries: Whenever the Dread Yonko makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, it can decide to roll an additional {@dice d20}. It can choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. The Dread Yonko can change the outcome of a roll when an attack is made against it. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or the Dread Yonko's. If more than one creature uses observation haki to influence the outcome of a roll, any disadvantage or advantage from observation haki applied to the roll will be canceled; no additional dice are rolled.

trait.name: Conqueror's Haki (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the Dread Yonko can manifest its frightful presence. Each creature of its choice that is within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw. A creature that fails becomes {@condition frightened} of it for 1 minute. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is incapactiated until the start of the Dread Yonko's next turn. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Dread Emperor's Wrath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the Dread Yonko would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 500 hit points, it recharges its Divine Departure, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the Dread Yonko can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the Dread Yonko after its Emperor's Wrath activates.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Devil Fruit User. If the Dread Yonko has consumed a Devil Fruit, it gains a Legendary Devil Fruit power, granting the Dread Yonko any abilities and spells it gives. The Dread Yonko will also gain all the weaknesses given to Devil Fruit users, such as water and seastone vulnerability. Its CR also increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Dread Yonko makes three saber attacks or three Air Slash attacks.

action.name: Supreme Meito
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 22} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 10d6 + 13}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 9d8}) force damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the Dread Yonko.

action.name: Air Slash
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 600 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 10d10}) slashing damage

action.name: Shave
entries: The Dread Yonko magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 200 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Divine Departure {@recharge 5}
entries: The Dread Yonko leaps up to 200 feet to a point it can see and makes a weapon attack against a creature within 5 feet of its landing spot with its Supreme Meito. Additionally, all creatures within 60 feet of the landing spot must make a {@dc 29} Dexterity saving throw, taking ({@dice 14d12}) force damage on a failed save and half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Observation Killer
entries: The Dread Yonko can use its reaction to cancel one Color of Observation spell, ability, or dice-altering effect being used by a creature it can see.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Dread Yonko can move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Heaven-Splitting Slash
entries: The Dread Yonko slashes its sword, sending out an energy slash which forms a line 150 feet long and 20 feet high. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 29} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes ({@dice 6d8}) slashing damage and ({@dice 6d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Attack (2/Round)
entries: The Dread Yonko makes a Supreme Meito attack.
If the Dread Yonko's Dread Emperor's Wrath trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Emperor's Shield (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Dread Yonko manifests its spirit into a suit of armor that protects it; it gains 77 temporary hit points until the start of its next turn.

Let's End this War (Costs 2 Actions). The Dread Yonko and its allies within 100 feet gain a +2 bonus to AC until the end of the Dread Yonko's next turn. Additionally, the Dread Yonko and its allies in this area also receive 20 temporary hit points, immunity from the {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} condition, and advantage on Saving throws made against Color of the Supreme King haki.

monster.name: Sea King Lord [Epic]
languages: telepathy 120 ft. (with others that can hear the "voice of all things")

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Sea King Lord's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 24}; {@hit 16} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Sea King Lord can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Chomp
entries: The Sea King Lord can use a bonus action to make a bite or swallow attack against a creature it has {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Colossal
entries: The Sea King Lord's space is 45' x 45'.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Sea King Lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Sea King Lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Sea King Lord's weapon attacks are treated as magical for overcoming resistances and immunities.

trait.name: Cataclysmic Rage of the Sea (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the Sea King Lord would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 500 hit points, it recharges its Seawater Cannon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the Sea King Lord can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the Sea King Lord after its Cataclysmic Rage of the Sea activates.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The Sea King Lord's weapon attacks do double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Water Sense
entries: When the Sea King Lord is completely submerged it gains tremorsense to 240 feet.

trait.name: Waves of Wrath
entries: Any bludgeoning damage dealt by the Sea King Lord from water-based attacks counts as magical for overcoming resistances and immunities.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sea King Lord can make one Bite Attack and one Constrict or Tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 22} to hit, reach 35 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 7d10 + 16}) piercing damage plus ({@dice 10d6}) cold damage, and if the Sea King Lord wishes, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 24}). If the creature is Large or smaller it is also {@condition restrained}. As long as the Sea King Lord maintains the grapple, it cannot bite another creature.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 22} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 10d10 + 16}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 24}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the sea king can't constrict another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 22} to hit, reach 45 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 7d12 + 16}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 30} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} or pushed 30 feet, the Sea King Lord's choice, and {@condition stunned} until the end of the Sea King's next turn.

action.name: Thunderous Roar
entries: The Sea King unleashes a deafening roar that can be felt and heard by any creature within 90 feet of it. Each creature in this area must make a {@dc 30} Constitution saving throw, taking ({@dice 11d6}) thunder damage and being {@condition deafened} on a failed save or taking half as much damage and not being {@condition deafened} on a successful save.

action.name: Seawater Cannon {@recharge 5}
entries: The Sea King Lord exhales a 280-foot cone wave of frigid seawater. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 29} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 195 ({@damage 30d12}) bludgeoning damage and 195 ({@damage 30d12}) cold damage, and is pushed to the end of the cone and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Swallow
entries: A Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the Sea King must make a {@dc 25} Strength saving throw or be swallowed and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Sea King, and it takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) acid damage at the start of each of the Sea King's turns.

The Sea King's stomach has an AC of 21 and if it takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Sea King must makea {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed contents of its stomach. Creatures that are regurgitated fall {@condition prone} within 10 feet of the Sea King. If the Sea King dies, a creature is no longer swallowed and may escape from the corpse by using 55 feet of its movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Sea King Lord can make a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Sea King Lord can move up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Whirlpool (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Sea King Lord forms a 30-foot radius vortex in a body of water within 120 feet of it and lasts until the end of the Sea King Lord's next turn. The vortex is considered difficult terrain and each creature or vehicle which starts its turn in the vortex's area must succeed on a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or be pulled to the center of the vortex. Additionally, creatures within the vortex without a swim speed have disadvantage on their attacks while they remain inside it.

legendary.name: Thunderous Roar (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Sea King Lord makes a Thunderous Roar attack.

legendary.name: Innate Casting (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Sea King Lord casts an at-will spell.
If the Sea King Lord's Cataclysmic Rage of the Sea trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Explosive Dive (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Sea King Lord dives into the water in an explosive motion. Each creature within 30 ft. of the Sea King Lord must succeed on a {@dc 28} Dexterity saving throw or take ({@dice 3d10}) bludgeoning damage and ({@dice 3d10}) cold damage from the splash and be knocked {@condition prone}. The Sea King can then swim up to its swimming speed.

mythic.name: Tail Sweep (Costs 4 Actions)
entries: The Sea King swings its tail in a 45-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 30} Dexterity saving throw or take ({@dice 7d12 + 16}) bludgeoning damage, be pushed back 30 feet, knocked {@condition prone}, and {@condition stunned} until the end of the Sea King's next turn.

trait.name: Devil Fruit User
entries: The logia user has eaten the Moku Moku no mi Devil Fruit, allowing its user to transform into, use, and manipulate smoke, becoming a "smoke human". It has the following weaknesses:

items: A devil fruit user has a permanent swimming speed of 0. When more than half-submerged in a body of water or liquid, the devil fruit user becomes {@condition incapacitated} and cannot move or take actions until it exits the body of water.
Devil fruit user cannot consume more than one Devil Fruit, or else they will immediately die. There may be unknown exceptions to this rule, however.

If a devil fruit user ever comes into direct contact with sea stone, they must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution Save, or become {@condition incapacitated} and can't move or take actions until they are no longer touching the material. If they succeed on the initial save, they must also save at the beginning of each following turn so long as they are touching the seastone.

trait.name: Logia Guard
entries: The logia user can spend an action to enter it's logia guard form. While in this form, it gains the following benefits:

items: It gains a +2 bonus to AC.
It has advantage on Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws.

It becomes a misty cloud of smoke for the duration, making its only method of movement a flying speed equal to its movement speed. It can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks. It remains hovering in the air even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise Incapacitated, unless by seastone or water. It can move through the space of another creature, and it doesn't count as difficult terrain. If it ends its turn in another creature's space, it is shunted to the last unoccupied space you occupied, and it takes {@damage 1d8} force damage.

It chooses which equipment it is holding transforms into its element and travels with it normally. Worn equipment functions as usual, but benefits from the logia user's resistances and immunities and attacks that normally phase through it will also phase through its equipment as if it is a part of its body.

entries: Moku Moku no Mi (Very Rare). This devil fruit has 13 charges, and any of its properties that require a saving throw have a save DC of 15 and it has a {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks. The user of this fruit can use an action to cast {@spell mage hand}, and its reach with its melee weapons increases by 30 feet, as its arms can turn into smoke and extend outward. Alternatively, it can expend 1 or more of the devil fruit's charges to cast one of the following spells from it: {@spell Fog Cloud} (1 charge), {@spell Misty Step} (2 charges), {@spell Gaseous Form} (3 charges), {@spell Stinking Cloud} (3 charges), {@spell Cloudkill} (5 charges), {@spell Investiture of Wind|XGE} (6 charges), {@spell Wind Walk} (6 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.. The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

trait.name: Seastone Weapon
entries: The tip of the rapier held by the logia user is made of seastone, and forces any Devil Fruit-using creature it hits to make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be subjected to its seastone weakness effects. Additionally, the rapier ignores immunity to piercing damage from devil fruit users.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The logia user makes three attacks with its seastone rapier. If either attack hits and the target is within 10 feet of a 5-foot cube of smoke or fog created by the logia user on a previous turn, the logia user can dismiss that smoke or fog and cause the target to take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage from smoke inhalation. The logia user can dismiss smoke or fog in this way no more than once per turn.

action.name: Seastone Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 35 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage. The logia user can then fill an unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of the target with smoke or fog (such as from the {@spell fog cloud} spell), which remains for 1 minute.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Six Powers and Haki)
headerEntries: The paramecia user's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:  3/day each: blur, expeditious retreat, feather fall (self), jump (self), misty step, see invisibility, shield  1/day each: arcane eye, haste (self) Netsu Netsu no Mi (Rare). This devil fruit has 9 charges, and any of its properties that require a saving throw have a save DC of 13 and it has a {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks. The user of this fruit can use an action to cast fire bolt or heat metal. Alternatively, it can expend 1 or more of the devil fruit's charges to cast one of the following spells from it: burning hands (1 charge), hellish rebuke (1 charge), scorching ray (2 charges), wall of fire (4 charges), or flame strike (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

trait.name: Devil Fruit User
entries: The paramecia user has eaten the Netsu Netsu no mi Devil Fruit, allowing its user to use and manipulate heat, becoming a "heat human". It has the following weaknesses:

items: A devil fruit user has a permanent swimming speed of 0. When more than half-submerged in a body of water or liquid, the devil fruit user becomes {@condition incapacitated} and cannot move or take actions until it exits the body of water.
Devil fruit user cannot consume more than one Devil Fruit, or else they will immediately die. There may be unknown exceptions to this rule, however.

If a devil fruit user ever comes into direct contact with sea stone, they must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution Save, or become {@condition incapacitated} and can't move or take actions until they are no longer touching the material. If they succeed on the initial save, they must also save at the beginning of each following turn so long as they are touching the seastone.

trait.name: Observation Haki (1/Day)
entries: Whenever the paramecia user makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, it can decide to roll an additional {@dice d20}. It can choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. The paramecia user can change the outcome of a roll when an attack is made against it. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or the paramecia user's. If more than one creature uses observation haki to influence the outcome of a roll, any disadvantage or advantage from observation haki applied to the roll will be canceled; no additional dice are rolled.

action.name: Fire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 120 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

walk.condition: (50 ft. in lion or hybrid form)

trait.name: Devil Fruit User
entries: The zoan user has eaten the Neko Neko no mi, Model: Lion zoan devil fruit, allowing it to transform into a lion or lion hybrid. It has the following weaknesses:

items: A devil fruit user has a permanent swimming speed of 0. When more than half-submerged in a body of water or liquid, the devil fruit user becomes {@condition incapacitated} and cannot move or take actions until it exits the body of water.
Devil fruit user cannot consume more than one Devil Fruit, or else they will immediately die. There may be unknown exceptions to this rule, however.

If a devil fruit user ever comes into direct contact with sea stone, they must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution Save, or become {@condition incapacitated} and can't move or take actions until they are no longer touching the material. If they succeed on the initial save, they must also save at the beginning of each following turn so long as they are touching the seastone.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The zoan user can use its action to polymorph into a Large lion-humanoid hybrid or into a Large lion, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it. is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The zoan user has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce (Lion or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: If the zoan user moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw Attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the zoan user can make one bite Attack against it as a bonus Action.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: In humanoid form, the zoan user makes two cutlass attacks or one rifle attack. In hybrid form, it can attack like a humanoid or make two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite (Lion or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw (Lion or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Cutlass (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Musket (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The tinkerer is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The tinkerer has the following wizard spells prepared:  Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, gust, prestidigitation  1st level (4 slots): burning hands, mage armor, magic missile, shield  2nd level (3 slots): mirror image, scorching ray  3rd level (3 slots): fly, lightning bolt, major image  4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, storm sphere  5th level (1 slot): cloudkill

action.name: Quarterstaff (Melee; One-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage

action.name: Quarterstaff (Melee; Two-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage

action.name: Fire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 120 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d10}) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elbaf warrior makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Spear (Melee; One-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d6 + 9}) piercing damage

action.name: Spear (Melee; Two-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage

action.name: Spear (Ranged)

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the bounty hunter has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the bounty hunter scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Confronting Capture
entries: The bounty hunter doesn't suffer disadvantage when making ranged attacks made within 5 feet of a creature. Additionally, creatures have disadvantage when attempting to resist being {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} as a result of any effect the bounty hunter creates.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the bounty hunter is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the bounty hunter instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The Bounty Hunter deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the bounty hunter that isn't incapacitated and the bounty hunter doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bounty hunter makes two shortsword attacks.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 7d6}) poison damage. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking the poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A creature can use its Action to make a {@dc 10} Strength check to free itself or another creature in a net, Ending the Effect on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net, AC 10, frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

trait.name: Shapechanger

Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies or is no longer exposed to the full moon.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Seraphim's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 20}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: detect magic, burning hands (as a 9th-level spell) 3/day each: dispel magic, fireball 1/day each: flame strike, sunburst

trait.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries: The Seraphim can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Destructive Death
entries: When the Seraphim dies, it explodes. Each creature within 30-feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't worn or carried.

trait.name: Face Scan
entries: A Seraphim instantly recognizes the name, bounty, and any other public knowldge of a creature it can see.

trait.name: Fiery Weapons
entries: The Seraphim's weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 36 ({@damage 8d8}) fire damage (included in the weapon attacks below).

trait.name: Flame Change
entries: The Seraphim can use a bonus action to activate or deactivate its flame. If it's flame is deactivated, the sepharim becomes resistant to fire damage instead of immune and receives a -2 penalty to Armor Class, but moves at double its movement speed and gains advantage on Dexterity checks and saving throws for the duration. These changes are reverted once the Seraphim re-activates its flame.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Seraphim has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Devil Fruit Lineage. If the Seraphim has been infused with Devil Fruit lineage factors, it gains a Very Rare or lower Fruit power, granting the Seraphim any abilities and spells it gives. The Seraphim will also gain all the weaknesses given to Devil Fruit users, such as water and seastone vulnerability. Its CR also increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Seraphim makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus ({@dice 8d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Longsword (One-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d8 + 9}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 8d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Longsword (Two-Handed)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d10 + 9}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 8d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Shave

action.name: Laser Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: The Seraphim fires an exploding laser beam at a point it can see within 120 feet. The explosion erupts in a 60-radius sphere centered on the chosen point, forcing each creature in the area to make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking ({@dice 26d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Immutable Form

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The pacifista has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Until the end of the Assassin's next turn, it can't take an Action on its turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

trait.name: Celestial Helmet
entries: The Celestial Dragon wears a bubble-like helmet around its head which supplies it with fresh air. While it wears this helmet, it is immune to any effect that would cause the Celestial Dragon to suffocate or become {@condition poisoned} from an airborne gas. If the Celestial Dragon takes 4 or more damage in a single turn, its helmet breaks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Six Powers and Haki)
headerEntries: The Pirate Leader's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 27}; {@hit 19} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: At Will: detect magic, dispel magic, toll the dead (17th level)  3/day each: blur, dominate person, fear, jump (self)  1/day each: arcane eye, control weather, death ward (self), dominate monster, earthquake, psychic scream

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Pirate Leader fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: King's Infusion Armament Haki
entries: The Pirate Leader's weapon attacks count as magical for the Purpose of overcoming Resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage, such as resistances granted by Devil Fruits. The Pirate Leader also adds an additional ({@dice 4d8}) force damage onto its melee weapon attacks and increases its melee weapon attack range by 5 feet.

trait.name: Observation Haki (3/Day)
entries: Whenever the Pirate Leader makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, it can decide to roll an additional {@dice d20}. It can choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. The Pirate Leader can change the outcome of a roll when an attack is made against it. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or the Pirate Leader's. If more than one creature uses observation haki to influence the outcome of a roll, any disadvantage or advantage from observation haki applied to the roll will be canceled; no additional dice are rolled.

trait.name: Conqueror's Haki (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the Pirate Leader can manifest its frightful presence. Each creature of its choice that is within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw. A creature that fails becomes {@condition frightened} of it for 1 minute. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is incapactiated until the start of the Pirate Leader's next turn. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Emperor's Wrath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the Pirate Leader would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 500 hit points, it recharges its Cataclysmic Slam, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the Pirate Leader can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the Pirate Leader after its Emperor's Wrath activates.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Devil Fruit User. If the Pirate Leader has consumed a Devil Fruit, it gains a Legendary Devil Fruit power, granting the Pirate Leader any abilities and spells it gives. The Pirate Leader will also gain all the weaknesses given to Devil Fruit users, such as water and seastone vulnerability. Its CR also increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Pirate Leader makes three Unarmed Strike attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 3d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus ({@dice 4d8}) force damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 27} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 600 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 9d6}) thunder damage

action.name: Shave
entries: The Pirate Leader magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Cataclysmic Slam {@recharge 5}
entries: The Pirate Leader slams the ground with haki and releases crushing force in a 60-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 ({@damage 11d12}) force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Cull the Weak
entries: The Pirate Leader casts {@spell toll the dead|XGE} (17th level)

legendary.name: Furious Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Pirate Leader makes one Unarmed Strike attack. If the attack hits a creature, the target must succeed on a {@dc 27} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the Pirate Leader until the end of its next turn.
If the Pirate Leader's Emperor's Wrath trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Emperor's Shield (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Pirate Leader manifests his spirit into a suit of armor that protects it; it gains 77 temporary hit points until the start of its next turn.

mythic.name: Ravaging Wave (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Pirate Leader unleashes a wave of deadly spirit energy. Each creature in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on the Pirate Leader must succeed on a {@dc 27} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes ({@dice 4d12}) force damage and be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The Pirate Elite can take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: While the Pirate Elite is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Pirate Elite makes three attacks: two with its saber and one with its pistol.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage

entries: The Pirate Lackey makes two melee attacks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Six Powers and Haki)
headerEntries: The Marine Leader's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: At Will: detect magic, dispel magic  3/day each: blur, dominate person, jump (self)  1/day each: arcane eye, death ward (self), dominate monster

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the Marine Leader fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Armament Haki
entries: The Marine Leader's weapon attacks count as magical for the Purpose of overcoming Resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage, such as resistances granted by Devil Fruits. The Marine Leader also adds an additional ({@dice 3d8}) force damage onto its melee weapon attacks.

trait.name: Observation Haki (3/Day)
entries: Whenever the Marine Leader makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, it can decide to roll an additional {@dice d20}. It can choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. The Marine Leader can change the outcome of a roll when an attack is made against it. Roll a {@dice d20}, and then choose whether the attack uses the attacker's roll or the Marine Leader's. If more than one creature uses observation haki to influence the outcome of a roll, any disadvantage or advantage from observation haki applied to the roll will be canceled; no additional dice are rolled.

trait.name: Conqueror's Haki (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the Marine Leader can manifest its frightful presence. Each creature of its choice that is within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. A creature that fails becomes {@condition frightened} of it for 1 minute. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is incapactiated until the start of the Marine Leader's next turn. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Iron Fist of Justice (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the Marine Leader would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 350 hit points, it recharges its Spirit Slam, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the Marine Leader can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the Marine Leader after its Iron Fist of Justice activates.

trait.name: Variant:
entries: Devil Fruit User. If the Marine Leader has consumed a Devil Fruit, it gains a Legendary Devil Fruit power, granting the Marine Leader any abilities and spells it gives. The Marine Leader will also gain all the weaknesses given to Devil Fruit users, such as water and seastone vulnerability. Its CR also increases by 2.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Marine Leader makes two Unarmed Strike attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d12 + 9}) bludgeoning damage plus ({@dice 3d8}) force damage. The target must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and can't take reactions, until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Ranged Leg Slash
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 600 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 8d6}) slashing damage

action.name: Shave
entries: The Marine Elite magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Spirit Slam {@recharge 5}
entries: The Marine Leader slams the ground with haki and releases crushing force in a 60-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 ({@damage 11d12}) force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: The Marine Leader makes one Unarmed Strike attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Marine Leader moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Shattering Punch (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Marine Leader releases a supersonic punch that releases devastating thunderous energy in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If the Marine Leader's Iron Fist of Justice trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Shave
entries: The Marine Leader uses its Shave ability, but only teleports up to half the distance.

mythic.name: Wave of Triumph (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Marine Leader releases a wave of conquering spirit energy that also empowers allies. Each creature of the Marine Leader's choice in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the Marine leader must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, half as much on a successful one. Also, a creature that fails this save becomes despaired until the end of the Marine Leader's next turn. Despaired creatures are under the effect of the {@spell bane} spell (no {@status concentration} required) for the duration. In addition, up to four creatures of the Marine Leader's choice (including itself) in that area becomes empowered until the end of the Marine Leader's next turn. Empowered creatures gain 10 temporary hit points and are under the effect of the {@spell bless} spell (no {@status concentration} required) for the duration.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}({@dice 2d10 + 7}) slashing damage plus ({@dice 3d8}) force damage. The target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. entries: The Marine Elite bolsters all nonhostile creatures within 120 feet of it until the end of its next turn. Bolstered creatures can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and they gain advantage on ability checks and saving throws until the end of the Marine Elite's next turn.

legendary.name: Conqueror's Surge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Marine elite releases a debilitating shockwave using its spirit. All other creatures within 60 feet of the Marine Elite must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
